contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=October 2012}} {{Primary sources|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox basketball biography | name = Yasemin Horasan | image = | caption = | league = [[Turkish Women's Basketball League]]<br>[[EuroLeague Women]] | height_ft = 6 | height_in = 2 | weight_lbs = 192 | position = [[Center (basketball)|Center]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|08|01}} | birth_place = [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] | death_date = | death_place = | team_link = Fenerbahçe Women's Basketball | team = Fenerbahçe Istanbul | number = 13 | college = | nationality = [[Turkey|Turkish]] | draft = | draft_team = | draft_year = | career_start = 1997 | former_teams = [[Beşiktaş Cola Turka (women's basketball)|Beşiktaş]] (1997-07) <br> [[Phard Napoli]] (2007-08) <br> [[Galatasaray Medical Park (women's basketball)|Galatasaray]] (2008-10) <br> [[Beşiktaş Cola Turka Women's Basketball|Beşiktaş Cola Turka]] (2010-12) | awards = }} '''Yasemin Horasan''' (born August 1, 1983) is a [[Turkey|Turkish]] professional basketball player of [[Fenerbahçe Women's Basketball|Fenerbahçe]].<ref>[http://www.fenerbahce.org/fb2008/detay.asp?ContentID=29931 Yasemin Horasan signed joined Fenerbahce]</ref> ==Career== Horasan played in the season 2002–2003 for [[Beşiktaş J.K.]] and was elected Most Valuable Player of [[Turkish Women's Basketball League]] including all domestic and foreign players. To improve her technique, she was sent by her club to [[IMG Academy]] in [[Bradenton, Florida]], [[United States|U.S.]], the best-known multi-sport training facility in the world. Horasan was member of the [[Turkey national women's basketball team|team]] participated at the [[Turkey at the 2005 Mediterranean Games|2005 Mediterranean Games]] in [[Almería]], [[Spain]], which won [[gold medal]]. She won the Turkish women's championship with Beşiktaş in 2004–2005. ==Honors== *'''[[Turkish Women's Basketball League]]''' **'''Winners (2):''' 2004-05, 2012-13 **'''Runners-up (1):''' 2009-10 *'''Turkish Cup''' **'''Winners (1):''' 2009-10 *'''Turkish Presidents Cup''' **'''Winners (1):''' 2006-07 *'''[[EuroLeague Women]]''' **'''Runners-up (1):''' 2013 *'''[[EuroCup Women]]''' **'''Winners (1):''' 2008-09 *'''[[FIBA Europe SuperCup Women|FIBA SuperCup]]''' **'''Runners-up (1):''' 2009 ==External links== *[http://www.tbl.org.tr/tbbl/oyuncu.asp?Kod=2400 Profile at tbl.org.tr] *[http://www.eurobasketwomen2009.com/en/cid_X6FnqP4DGbURoW6MX7dzD2.playerID_25287.compID_pnlxO1HYJhUh,MTfrmUO03.season_2009.roundID_6341.teamID_376.html Player Profile at Eurobasket Women 2009] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Fenerbahçe Istanbul Squad}} {{Navboxes||title=Squads|list1= {{Turkey Women Basketball Squad 2012 Summer Olympics}} {{Turkey Women's EuroBasket 2011}} {{Turkey Women's EuroBasket 2009}} {{Turkey Women's EuroBasket 2007}} {{Turkey Women's EuroBasket 2005}} {{Galatasaray 2008–09 EuroCup Women champions}} }} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Horasan, Yasemin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Basketball player | DATE OF BIRTH = August 1, 1983 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Horasan, Yasemin}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Istanbul]] [[Category:Centers (basketball)]] [[Category:Turkish women's basketball players]] [[Category:Turkish expatriate basketball players]] [[Category:Turkish expatriates in Italy]] [[Category:Galatasaray women's basketball players]] [[Category:Fenerbahçe women's basketball players]] [[Category:Basketball players at the 2012 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic basketball players of Turkey]] {{Turkey-basketball-bio-stub}}
